page.title: 10ST. JOHN'S WOOD C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1970 to take the children from the new Longridge estate. Children from Shaw Heath were also directed to the school. The school is semi- open plan in design. Currently there are 110 children aged 5 to 11 on roll. These are taught in 4 classes. School starts at 9 am and closes at 3.30 pm with a mid-morning and mid-afternoon break of 15 minutes. A cafeteria style meal is served at midday. About 60 children have free school meals. On 3 days the day starts with a Religious Assembly. Apart from Mathematics and Language (English) much of the study is centred around "themes" which involve Science, History and Geography as this Domesday Project has done. There is P.E. every day and swimming for the older ones once a week. Children sing and play percussion instruments.
